entry.content:
This CL fixes URL handling issues that allow Ash browser to open when

the user clicks a link in SWA while pressing the shift or control key.

entry.title: Ash: Move existing interception for new window creation requests
entry.content:
Currently, WebContentsImpl::CreateNewWindow has an interception that

opens the requested URL with Lacros if LacrosOnly is enabled.



This CL removes it to make CreateNewWindow less complicated, and put it

in ChromeContentBrowserClient::CanCreateWindow, which is used for

implementing the pop-up blocker.

entry.title: Reland "Make "CreateShortcut" use document title not web app (manifest) title"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 2531085825c6e873c8e570a017782f85b1445fc0.



Reason for revert: Reland with fix for mac tests (passed in PS#4).

Note: Patchset #1 is a clean reland so you can see the delta.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Make "CreateShortcut" use document title not web app (manifest) title"

>

> This reverts commit 5872f59bd55b3078c6cd4caedc30ef9e4d1ca780.

>

> Reason for revert: Causing test failures on Mac, see crbug.com/1470663

>

> Original change's description:

> > Make "CreateShortcut" use document title not web app (manifest) title

> >

> > With the "kCreateShortcutIgnoresManifest" flag on, the "Create

> > Shortcut" flow defaults to using the app title found in the web app

> > manifest (if available) rather than the document title. Using the

> > document title is consistent with non-app pages and is more sensible

> > given it is creating a shortcut to the current document, not to the app.

> >

> > Updates affected web app integration test driver function.

> >

> > Bug: 1392652

> > Change-Id: I0d4d993bbf71624a7ead7315cd8fe9d3ee9db82c

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4692455

> > Reviewed-by: Alan Cutter

> > Commit-Queue: Glen Robertson

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180153}

>

> Bug: 1392652, 1470663

entry.title: shortcuts: Fix re-adding custom accelerator does not store in prefs correctly
entry.content:
This fixes a bug in the follow scenario:

1. User add Accelerator_A to Shortcut_A

2. User then adds Accelerator_A to Shortcut_B

3. User re-adds Accelerator_A to Shortcut_A



Step 2 is when the bug would occur in which the prefs associated

with Step 1 are not removed (Step 2 should've removed it due to

conflict resolution).



Adds a new test to catch this scenario.



Bug: b/216049298

Test: ash_unittests

Change-Id: I6689ecbd815e6037a92388ad50886c330dc8daa4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4752474

Reviewed-by: David Padlipsky

Commit-Queue: Jimmy Gong

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181266}

entry.title: [infra] Run all android actions remotely on Siso CQ builders
entry.content:
Some Java actions don't run remotely by default.

This avoids developer builds to get slowdown.

However, builders can benefit from running them remotely.



Android clean build metrics show 2x faster performance.

So it would improve the performance of real CQ builds, too.



Bug: b/284252142, b/277863839

Change-Id: I18500016b4f41a983f5c8dfabdaa292163736dda

entry.title: Prevent crash when asked to provide an out-of-bounds grid cell
entry.content:
This CL replicates a workaround between the diffable data source

codepath and the original codepath.

The workaround handles a potential case where UIKit asks for a cell at

an invalid index path.



I initially thought that the issue was no longer a problem, otherwise

the DCHECK_LT would have triggered reports, now that DCHECK are hit in

production too. But it seems that this can still happen (cf bug).



I add a DumpWithoutCrashing to both codepaths.



Bug: 1468753

Low-Coverage-Reason: Codepath not hit on CQ (DumpWithoutCrashing)

entry.title: [ssci] Add Shipped field and update NOT_SHIPPED uses
entry.content:
This CL adds the Shipped field to README files. See the LSC

doc at go/lsc-chrome-metadata. Any uses of NOT_SHIPPED are also removed.



These files were originally missed in the main LSC effort due to:

* NOT_SHIPPED was in the Description field (harmless but updated anyway)

* Casing of field was off ("License file" instead of "License File")

* //third_party/node/README.chromium has multiple packages' metadata, so only the first package's metadata had been updated in the initial effort

* not a README.chromium file (README_GardinerMod.txt)

entry.title: Fix CanReadWithoutStalling() when guessing coded sizes on Android.
entry.content:
The guessing path results in stalling until a frame is rendered, but

didn't tell the renderer it couldn't have any more frames -- which

results in buffering forever.



This should reproduce everywhere, so it's unclear why it's only

showing up in webview.

entry.title: customization: Add support for KeyEvent observing
entry.content:
Adds support for observing key events which does the following:

- Blocks key events from the given device

- Notifies observers when the event is blocked and tells the observers

what key was pressed.



These key events can come from either mice or graphics tablets.

entry.title: Remove incorrect checks in TestGeolocationUrlLoaderFactory.
entry.content:
Latitude/longitude values of 0 are valid. They range from [-90, 90]

and [-180, 180] respectively. Additionally, an accuracy of 0 is

also valid. See Geoposition::Valid() for criteria.



This was caught while making a test suite that exercised a range

of valid latitudes/longitudes, and some of them happened to use

0 degrees. The test failed unexpectedly when it should really

pass.



Bug: b:289275232

entry.title: [Extensions] Remove a data member from ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter.
entry.content:
This is one in a series of CLs that will move data out of the

ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter that is not keyed by BrowserContext.

This will allow for a more straightforward approach when breaking it

up into multiple per-BrowserContext instances.



This class has a map of of WebRequestRulesRegistry instances with a

composite key consisting of a pointer to a BrowserContext instance

and an integer key for the webview ID. This key can be decomposed

by having each BrowserContextData instance contain the registries

for that instance, keyed by webview ID.



Bug: 1433136

entry.title: [Tailored security] Implement saving of retry states
entry.content:
When kTailoredSecurityRetryForSyncUsers is enabled, the

tailored security service will save whether a retry is needed or

not.



1. if Chrome is ended before the original flow or any observer-based

recovery method succeeds, then this state-based recovery method will

try again later because the state will still be RETRY_NEEDED.



2. If any of the flows end up succeeding, the service will update the

state to NO_RETRY_NEEDED, which will prevent the recovery mechanism

from trying again in the future.



Also adds a return for the case where no window was available.



Change-Id: Iac2f72b5f58f6e4021ef4c865a75374baf18478b

entry.title: Add user heartbeat event.
entry.content:
Manually enqueue a heartbeat event with EventType::kUser instead of

EventType::kDevice when EncryptedReportingManualTestUserHeartbeatEvent feature is enabled. This is so that we use a user DM token instead

of a device DM token when TAST testing reporting from unmanaged devices (which don't have device DM tokens).

entry.title: [CrOS Cellular] Modifying the hermes network operation timeout
entry.content:
Our operation timeout was set to 4 min and that is in line with

platform's timeout for carrier call. However, theoretically, the call

could take little over 4 mins end to end if the carrier call itself

takes up 4 mins. We have received some reports of DBUS_NOREPLY that

would confirm this.

entry.title: Avoid unnecessary loops in external_metrics.cc.
entry.content:
To test multiple histograms:



$ echo -e \

'\x30\x00\x00\x00linearhistogram\x00Platform.Mutexlox 2 10 100\x00'\

>> /var/lib/metrics/uma-events

wait 30s

check chrome://histograms/Mutexlox (should have 100 samples in bucket 2)



BUG=b:292583990

TEST=unit tests; tast run platform.Histograms

entry.title: wm: Desk bar and alt tab background blur behind a flag
entry.content:
Background blur is expensive and has impacted performance in the past.

This gives us the option to disable (along with hotseat, shelf, app

list container) on several devices, and also to disable via flag.



These two aren't the only usages of background blur, but they are the

largest. Also adds backdrop filter quality, which will improve

performance once it is implemented for the skia renderer.



Test: manual

Bug: b/294864751

entry.content:
Extract CanMerge() so that the fast path and the normal path can

share the same code in Merge(). This can help prevent missing code

in the fast path when we add new PendingLayer properties.

entry.title: Output each individual rect for links in PDFs.
entry.content:
Simply outputting the bounding box is problematic if the link is split

across multiple lines, as it might overlap with other links on the lines

involved, and thus partially or completely make them inaccessible.



This change requires quite a few of the unit tests for this

functionality to be updated. Also added a new test

PrintContextTest.SingleLineLinkNextToWrappedLink



Bug: 1396019

entry.title: FSA: Implement method to retrieve dormant persisted grants
entry.content:
Implements `GetDormantPersistedObjects` which returns a set of the

dormant grants for a given origin. This method is needed to support

FSA Persistent Permissions implementation, and will be used in followup

changes to implement the restore prompt feature.



Implements helper method `HasGrantedActiveGrant` whose return

value is one of the determining factors in retrieving dormant grants.



Updates naming of `GetExtendedGrantedObjects` ->

`GetExtendedPersistedObjects` for naming consistency.



Adds a boolean parameter to the

`SetOriginHasExtendedPermissionForTesting` method to allow for

testing dormant grants scenarios.



Bug: 1011533

Change-Id: Ic7c21325fce46c41580d7347f296f49e2133f911

entry.title: [switch access]: more narrowly scope EventHandler observation
entry.content:
Speculative fix for crash.



Given no assumptions on when OnJavascriptAllowed|Disallowed gets called,

it's possible we end up with the following calls:



OnJavascriptDisallowed

OnKeyEvent

FireWebUIListener





Work around this by removing the listener in OnJavascriptDisallowed.



Bug: b/294778786

entry.title: customization: Add support for MouseEvent button observing
entry.content:
Adds support for observing mouse button events which does the following:

- Blocks mouse button events from the given device

- Notifies observers when the event is blocked and tells the observers

what button was pressed.



These mouse button events can come from either mice or graphics tablets.

entry.title: Add and apply CookieInclusionStatus::EXCLUDE_THIRD_PARTY_PHASEOUT
entry.content:
This exclusion reason should be added instead of

CookieInclusionStatus::EXCLUDE_USER_PREFERENCES when getting/setting

cookies meets the following conditions:

1. 3PC blocking is turned on with local switch (added in

crbug.com/1441039)

2. cookie is accessed in a 3p context

3. cookie is SameSite=None;Secure and not partitioned

4. the access is not allowed by explicit settings

entry.title: Do not regenerate WPT Manifest
entry.content:
'@memoized' uses function parameters as the key for the cache. Setting

exclude_jsshell to False will cause a cache miss, and the manifest to be

regenerated, which is slow (>30s). This is not needed now as we are collecting tests inside the wrapper, and Wptrunner won't report

status for jsshell tests.

entry.title: [A11y] Fix for longstanding hypertext errors
entry.content:
Two root causes were found and fixed:

1. An iframe or other child tree that is destroyed must update the

hypertext of the owning node.

2. A node that becomes a leaf must still update its hypertext.

Previously we did not add that previous hypertext owning parent.



Also required fixing of firing of alert event in

content_setting_image_view.cc. It fired a redundant event, and the alert

was not fired on an object with the correct role, which triggers a DCHECK unrelated to the problem solved in this CL. The fix is to just set the correct role. This change was required in order to get the new page tab a11y browsertests to pass. Alerts work on every platform, so there is no need for the #if.



Fixed: 1404671

Change-Id: Id7f0624e98a8577dd4656f24ac63972adc5a38eb

entry.title: [SDA] Fix numerical stability of contain range.
entry.content:
Previously, scroll driven animations were fixed at 100s duration.

This is problematic when trying to align limited precision of box

positioning with the 1 microsecond precision requirement for

animations. To address the problem, the duration is adjusted so that

the maximum error in progress calculations aligns with the precision

requirement.

entry.title: shimless: Change warning color to comply with min. WCAG contrast ratio
entry.content:
Our A11y team has stated that the minimum contrast ratio for text

should be 4.5:1.



The old warning text color (#e37400) has a contrast ratio of 3.1:1

(using https://webaim.org/resources/contrastchecker/), whereas the new

text color (#b06000) has a ratio of 4.64:1.



Our UX/UI team advised the use of this new color.

Note that Shimless RMA is forced to run in light mode, so we don't

need to worry about supporting dark mode.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4paLEbAQbbtVL6F

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/nrMNnfn3HgqGwLQ



Bug: b/287317464

> [sync] Sync test to verify pref from persisted storage is not reset

>

> This is to verify that once the pref is loaded from the persistent

> there was a case where DualLayerUserPrefStore::SetValue() before sync is

entry.title: [Rounded Windows] Update frame when devtools get hidden due to resizing
entry.content:
Currently, frame corners are updated for chromeOS ash when devtools

are either toggled or changed. (situations when

UpdateDevToolsForContents() is called) but not when devtools are hidden after resizing.



This is fixed by updating frame corners whenever the browser view

layout changes. This also presents an opportunity to simply code:

get rid of code listening to layout changes that require to update

frame rounded corners (i.e side panel opening, devtools docked placement changing etc)

entry.title: Mac immersive: handle events while showing alert in fullscreen
entry.content:
Currently, windows that should not handle their own commands defer to

a "bubble parent", defined as a parent window which conforms to

`CommandDispatchingWindow`.



Unfortunately, all `NativeWidgetMacNSWindow` including the overlay

window conform to this protocol. That means when an alert is showing

in full-screen, its bubble parent is the overlay window which can't

handle events by itself, but does not itself bubble to the browser

window as it should, since it's in the toolbar's hierarchy.



This change pushes the bubble parent logic out of command dispatcher

and into `NativeWidgetMacNSWindow` (and renames it to

`commandDispatchParent` to minimize confusion with "bubble" as a noun).

This allows us to set an explicit override; we take advantage of this to

set the browser window as the overlay window's command dispatch parent.



Bug: 1469896

Change-Id: Ie8d68a018683881c7e63d63c87e8f77e07d71b93

entry.title: Tab DnD: Adds support to drag and drop a tab to specific location in the other Chrome instance.
entry.content:
If the drop is on an existing tab then the tab will be inserted before it if the drop is on the left half of the tab or after it the drop position is on the right half of the tab.

If dropped in the empty space of the tabs toolbar then the tab is added at the end of the tabs list.



A recording of the tabs being shuffled around in 3 Chrome instances is - http://shortn/_qvJRuHd2hE.



Correctly set the height of tabs toolbar view, rather than assuming it to be half of the toolbar container view.

entry.title: Treat merged policies with cloud-only conflicts as cloud-only.
entry.content:
Prior to this change, merged policies failed the cloud-only check even

if they consisted of cloud-only policies.



This allows policies to be applied from multiple cloud sources (e.g.

cloud machine and cloud user) and still be treated as cloud-only upon

being merged.



The presence of at least one non-cloud conflict causes a merged policy

to fail the cloud-only check.
